page.title: 05THE CHURCH BUILDING-BLEWBURY
page.content: THE TOWER,LARGELY A REPLICA OF THAT AT EAST HENDRED,WAS ADDED IN THE 15TH CENTURY,AS WERE BOTH PORCHES.THE SOUTH PORCH RETAINS ITS ANCIENT LINES,BUT THE NORTH ONE WAS COMPLETELY REBUILT IN 1882 . THE FONT IS PERPENDICULAR WHILE THE WOODEN CHEST IN THE NORTH AISLE IS EARLIER,BEING DECORATED IN STYLE. ONE OF THE MEDIEVAL BELLS HAS SURVIVED THE OLDEST BEING THE NUMBER 6 OF 1586. NUMBER 3 AND 4 ARE DATED 1663 AND 1689 RESPECTIVELY,NUMBER 5 AND 7,1704 AND 1752.THE TENOR(19CWT)WAS RECAST IN 1825 AND THE TREBLE AND NUMBER 2 WERE INSTALLED DURING THE RESTORATION OF THE TOWER IN 1906.THERE IS ALSO A SANCTUS BELL OF 1819.THE CLOCK IS AT LEAST EARLY 17TH CENTURY,FOR IT WAS REPORTED AS BEING IN DECAY IN 1641 AND WAS NOT REPAIRED UNTIL 1663.
